How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:What could happen to you after you see some beautiful clouds above you? Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Dull:**<n>Weather makes cloud formation possible. Without weather, no clouds would form. Too bad for us, most of the weather events have a negative impact on our mood and activities. <n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: What could happen to you after getting into a traffic jam on the road? Choices: A: your temper may rise B: you may swear C: your patience will be tested D: you'll spend more of your time E: the road is more packed<n><n>**D:**<n>It's true that spending too much of time on the road makes you furious. However, it doesn't really mean it is a big deal if you get stuck in the traffic. People react different to things, and sometimes traffic jams can be a good topic to chit chat with other drivers in the jam.<n><n># Chapter 5 - Seating, Role Play, Group Discussion and Voting<n><n>### Task 1: Seating Arrangement<n><n>### Instructio: <n> <n>### Question:<n>**Q:** What number is missing? <n><n>#### A. It didn't matter that he didn't have any weights to put it on or anyone to hold it steady with as he was standing by himself and empty handed at the moment.<n><n>### [Input:](The man set the glass on the table.)  He didn't heaving thing to put it on, on he laced the what to balance it<n><n>### Response:(The man set glass on the table.) He didn't have any tenacity to put it on, no one to hold it steady with and no skills to balance it.<n><n>### Input:(The man set the glass to stand on the table.) The man didn't have any weight to put it on, not a single what to hold it with, and no one around to help him balance it.<n><n><n>### Response<n>The man set the glass of the table.  He didn't have anything heavy to steady it with, or someone around to support it, so it didn't matter that much.<n>

Choices: A, B, C D E.<n><n>```python<n>a =int(input("What size of pants do Mary like? "))<n>if (a == 'a'):<n>  print('answer = 2')<n>if (a =='b'):<n>  print('a=3')<n>elif (a =='c'):<n>  print('d = 4')<n>else (a=='e'):<n>  print('f = 5')<n>```<n><n><n><n>### Input : Answer:<n><n>```<n>What size of pants does Mary like? <n>```<n><n>```python<n>i = 0<n>while i <9:<n>   if (input("What size of shirt are you buying? ")) == 'B':<n>      print("You buy B-Size Shirt")<n>   else:<n>      i=i+1<n>      continue<n>   print("you bought an A-Size shirt ")<n>   print("you won $50 million")<n>```<n><n><n>### Demostration<n>```python<n><n>```<n><n>### Instructions:Write a program that correctly completes the request.

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:Where would you expect to find a pizzeria while shopping? Choices:  A: chicago B: street C: little italy D: food court E: capital cities<n><n>### Response:		If the shopping center is designed to have a pizzeria, you could expect to find one in the food court. However, the capital cities could also have pizzerias, as they might have a larger selection of shops.<n><n>### Input : Mary's dog ran away from his new owner and they think that he went to their neighbor. The reason she was looking in the livingrroom is because she was looking for Mandy the dog.<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>* I want each team of 2 or 3 to respond to all task (6)<n><n>* I want the teams to use the knowledge / skill they have about the tasks to develop their responses / answer to the task.<n><n>* When a team has completed a task, copy all their answers for that task to this sheet.<n><n>* Check all of the sheets that have responses for each team. A troll was lying on the floor and there was a sword laying on the stone next to it. How many keys did she have?<n>### Instruement: <n>```python<n>if(sword!= "sword"):<n>    print("no sword here")<n>    quit()<n>elif(key!= "key" or sword!= "sword or key or both"):<n>    print ("there's no sword or key there.")<n>    quit()<n>answer = sword + key<n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Jane was walking down the path way, she came across a truck. It had a lock box and a chuck, key was in the box. In the next room she found a key, so she went and unlocked the box, and found $3, 650 000 in gold. She had to pay 51% tax on the gold. She then was robbed and lost 35% of it. The cash that she lost was $52, 700 000  of the original $3, 636, 500 00. How much gold did she find?<n>Answer: $2, 279 516<n><n>### Output:<n>Input: Jane found $2, 280. If she paid 51% taxes on it, her money would be $2, 088<n><n>Input (a): The fox found the gold.<n><n>### Output (b): Tax = 2,473,432<n><n>### Output<n>Input: Jane lost $57, 950, 000. What percent did she lose of her wealth?<n>Answer: -16.48%<n>

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Rowling and first appeared in the novel Harry Potter and the Philosopher's stone and was published yearly until 2007 when a complete collection was published, with the ultimate book Harry Potter and the deathly Hallows. Choices : A: 4 B:0 C:25<n><n>### Response D: 4<n><n>- Answer D: 4<n>- Reason: The box is a container with a square-based, open-ended and having six rectangular sides and each box has 4 rectangular sides which make the answer 4<n><n>### Input = How many weeks does it take for a dog to sheds?  Choices:  A :2 weeks  B: 9 weeks  C:5 weeks<n><n>### Response E: 2 weeks<n><n>- Answer E : 2 weeks<n>- Reason : Dogs shed on a seasonal basis, in spring they produce more hair to adapt to the warmer weather and they shed again in autumn when the temperature is cooler.  Dogs usually start their seasons in March or April, and June as well it depends entirely on the breed but they generally can shed anywhere 1-4 times a year and the shedding is caused by hormonal changes, changing in seasons to adjust to the temperature, stress, illness and overgrowing hair.  Usually a dog will go through two or three shedding periods a year.<n><n>### Input=How many times can you subtract 2001 from 2000?  Choices  :  A : 0 B: 1 C : 2 <n><n>### Response C:2<n><n>- Answer C:2<n>- Reason: When an odd number is divided by the same even number the remainder always gets a remainder of the same number<n><n>##

Choices: A: depressed B. downcast; C: angry D: gloomy E: sorrowful<n>Answer::  A<n><n>Input: If you see a boy standing for an hour on one leg do not give him another penny; he has probably stood on that leg before for hours.  The same boy, if he asked to buy a stick and an apple, buy him a stick and an apple; for he is doing you a favor by asking.  Do as much good, as you can by those who can do nothing to you; but you should be able to do no good which you choose not to do, and are not afraid to perform.<n><n>True or False: What does this mean?<n><n>Answer: What the narrator is trying to convey is that everyone needs to support those in need, but sometimes that support is unnecessary or unwarranted.  It also suggests that sometimes a person may be seeking someone else's financial support because, in reality, their need is only temporary and a short-term solution to a problem can be provided until the problem is solved. Additionally, if a person is asking for money it doesn't indicate that they are being truthful about their situation and it may simply be a ruse intended to con people out of money.<n>

Choices:  A: united states B: sky C: court D: field of flowers E: orchard<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>*The answer can be found on any page but does not involve bees.*<n><n>### Instructions:The numbers are shown below<n><n>| 0   |  2   |  4   |  6   |  8   |<n>|:---:|:---:|--:|:---:<n>| 1   |  3   |  5   |  7   |  9<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The pattern to the number of times each number is showing can be seen as a repeating pattern. The process of figuring 10 is the same as figuring 20, the same for 30 and so on. The repeating pattern in each set is 3, 2, 1.<n><n>### Input (5 numbers)<n> | *5   |  4   * |  3   | 2   * | *1  <n><n>### Response<n><n>*The numbers are shown above.*<n><n>| 1  |  2    |  3    |  4    |  5 <n>|:--|--:|:--:|--:| :--<n>| 2  | 4   | 6   | 8  | 10<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>| 3   |  4  <n>|:---:<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>*The number will be found in the pattern 3, 2.*<n><n>*The numbers will be 3 and 4.*<n><n>### Input<n><n> | *9   |   7   <n> -----------------------<n>8<n>*<n><n>### Response (*1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9*)<n><n>####<n>### Instrucction:Add two integers. The integer can be found on any of the numbers you will see.<n><n>####<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>| 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 |  5  | 6<n><n>####<n><n>||| 4 | 3 | 6 | 9 | 1<n>||| 0 | 4 | 8 | 16 | 2<n><n>### Input (*3, 1, 4, 3, 8, 4, 1*)

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:Where would a lizard surprise a person? Choices:  A: new mexico B: forrest C: dessert D: garden E: creek<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Option D<n>

I didn't get a ice cream.  How much ice cream was left over?"<n>### Response: "The boys have their ice cream.  There is none left."<n><n>### Instuctions:Rewrite these sentences with a transitive verb.<n><n>### 1) "He had no good advice to give."<n>### Response:  "He had good advice to give." How would you solve this in a single expression? There is no need to write a single function, as it could be solved with string concatenation. You are given the answer from the following options for this question. Choose the answer that corresponds to what you have submitted. Answer:<n><n>```<n>const getQuestion2 = () => ('You have the correct answer!');<n>```<n><n>> This task requires you to use the forEach method in order to iterate over an array. Choose the correct solution from the options:  A: _A, B: _B, C: _C, D: _D, E: _E<n><n>```<n>.forEach((i) => {<n>  console.log("i", i);<n>});<n>```<n><n>>  Consider the function findFirst(collection, searchFn).  It will search for a matching value on an element and remove it if found then returns the index  of the element that has been found. This task requires you to find a solution without removing. Choose the correct answer:  <n>If 2 is found at index 0, 3 is found at index 3 and 4 at index 5 then the function should return the index 4.  If the function was not found, then the function should return -1 as an error. A: _A,B: _B,C: _C, D, _E, F: _F<n><n>```<n>FindFirst(<n>  [2, 3, 4, 5],<n>  n => {<n>    return n === 2;<n>  }<n>)<n><n>```<n><n>> Consider the following snippet.  You are asked to determine whether the variable i is greater than or equal to j where i and i are members of an array.  Which of the following would you write to determine that j is a negative number and greater than the maximum number in the array?  A: _A: _A B: _B: _B C: _C: _C D: _D: _D  E: _E: _E<n><n><n>```<n>if (j > i

He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:He had done a great job with the scary decorations, they were completely what? Choices:  A: terrible B: little C: halloween D: small E: horrible<n><n>### Response:		Halloween<n><n>### Input:(8 - 6)^3 =<n><n>### Response:(56 - 21)^3 = (56x21)^3 = 7961<n><n>### Instructions:How much more is 59436 than -23043? Choices:  A: cars B: city street C: street corner D: fork in road E: at a red light<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n><n>### Input : You must turn left at the light, go straight for five lights, and then turn right.  What color will the light be at the third intersection? Choices: A: red B: yellow C: green D: orange E: white<n><n>### Response : E<n><n><n>### Instructions:Enter a string. Your task is to return a new string containing *every 3rd character.* The first character should be the one that follows the *first 3 characters of the string.* The second character should be the one immediately after that. The third character should be the one after the next three characters. For instance, in the input string "The bobtailed cat ran by," the output answer would be "bcat."<n><n>### Instinct:<n>11212 The bobtailed cat<n>222 ran<n>32 by<n><n>### Answer:<n>b<n>a t<n>cat<n><n>### Input  :You are given a string containing only uppercase characters. You are given another string. You need to replace all the characters of the first string with the ones matching your replacement. For instance, if "ABC" is the first string and "DEF" is the replacement string, then the new string should be "DEFDEFDEF". What is the shortest possible length of the string to replace all characters with?<n>

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65. If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Choices:  A: cook dinner B: study french cooking C: taste sauce D: prepare food E: thin sauce<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>This prompt is asking what a chef does during the evening. Possible choices are: *cook dinner* or *prepare food* or *thin sauce*. There is a difference between cooking and thinning sauce.<n>```<n>// What does a chef do when he is working in the evening?<n>let chefJobs = ["cook dinner", "prepare food", "thin sauce"];<n>let chefJob = String(prompt("What does a chef do during the evening? Choices include" + chefJobs + ": A: cook dinner B C: taste sauce \n"));<n>if (chefJob == "cook dinner" || chefJob == "prepare food")<n>{<n>	//code<n>}<n>else if (chefJob == 4)<n>{<n>	// code<n>}<n>```<n><table><n><tr><td>\code </td><td> </td></tr><n></table><n>

Choices:  A: sneezing B: fatigue C: house clean D: feeling satisfied E: getting good grades<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Demand:Write a function to accept a string input and determine whether or not you can put the string into this function, and if you can put the string, the function should show if it's a palindrome.<n><n>### Creation:<n>Write a function that checks whether a passed in string is a palindrome. Input: <n>```<n>string s = "abba"<n>```<n>Response: <n>```<n>bool isPalindrome(string s)<n>{<n>   if (s == "" || s[0] == "" || s.length == 1) <n>   {<n>     return false;<n>   }<n><n>   for(int i = 1; i!= s.length; ++i) <n>   { <n>     if (s[i]!= s[s.length - i]) <n>     {<n>       return false;<n>     } <n>   }<n>   return true;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input and Demand:<n>Input: I would like you to write a program to get the square root of a number, and also to round to the nearest whole number and display it,<n><n><n>Demand: <n>Write a program to get the Square root by dividing by half and then  repeating until the result is less than.5.<n>Write a program to round the square root by dividing by.5 and then  repeating until<n>the result is less than.25.<n>Write a function that will display if the number is odd or even.<n><n>### Response<n>```<n>int squareRoot(int x) {}<n>int round(int x) {<n>    while (x >.5)<n>    {<n>        x = (x+.5)/2;<n>    }<n>    return x;<n>}<n><n>int isEven(int x) { }<n>```

You can claim compensation through an insurance company or the owner of the property where the accident occurred. Alternatively, you may be able claim compensation through a government agency such as the Department of Labor or your local city council. In some cases, there are no requirements for insurance or coverage. In these cases, if someone caused you bodily harm they are legally obligated to pay for medical bills and expenses related to your injury.<n><n>### Input1: Write the mathematical expression for the following:  A:<n><n>Output: Write a response that appropriates completes the request. This could be any word or phrase.<n>   Example: The sum of 49 is 100.<n><n>2. Then, type ‚Äú! in front of the word you want to convert to a formula.<n>   Example:!in  front of<n><n>3. Now, create your formula. For example, ‚Äúin! of + is‚Äù would give you the value 15.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>### Example1:<n><n>## Example 1: Write an expression for the question asked. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:The person was looking up airline and hotel prices, what was he looking to do? Choices:  A: control computer B: separate things C: go on vacation D: cross street E: go out<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**The person was looking up [a word] and [a word] choices: A: control computer B. separate things C: go of [a word] D. cross street E: go on vacation**<n><n>### Input 2:<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>**The price of the meal costs $67 choose A,C,D,E choices: A: Sarah, Mary, Tuan split the cost equally**

Choices:  A: kitchen B: child's hand C: street D: toy store E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		If the ball came from a soccer game then it is dirty, and you should only play with it in the street or on the child's hand.<n><n>### Input<n>Choose the response that is most appropriate to a given problem.<n>### Chooses:<n> A: Kick it over a fence.<n> B: Take it to a soccer game.<n><n>### Response<n>B<n>### Explanation:Kick the ball through the window or on the kid's hand, but do not take the ball to a soccer game, that would be a waste of the ball.<n>### Explanations:<n>If you were going to a soccer game then you should take the ball to a toy store,  but do not take it to the child's hand because it will get dirty or stolen, and do not kick it over the fence because it will miss and hit your soccer teammate playing.<n><n>### Explanatios:<n>Take the ball to the child's or street hand but not to the soccer game because there is already a soccer team playing with soccer balls and you do not want to steal them.<n>Also the ball will get stolen from child's hand. <n>### Explanatory:<n>If the ball was kicked over the fence it would hit the grass so do not kick it over. If the ball was brought to the child's the ball would get dirty and be stolen.<n><n>### Answer<n>If you were looking for a ball, take it to a toy store. Do not take it to a soccer match because there are soccer players with balls. When you leave the soccer match take it to the child because the ball will be dirty in a soccer match.<n>### Clarifications:<n>It would be a waste of money to walk with the ball to the soccer match, and it would be a crime to take it from other soccer teams.<n>If you were going by child toy store you could only go to the street or child's. If you picked from the street of the child's the child could steal or scratch it.<n>The child will take the ball to a better spot to play.<n><n>### Clarification:<n>If you were looking  for a ball it would be a waste of time to walk to the soccer match to take the same ball

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:The whole family was playing cards, they were full of joy and what? Choices:  A: sadness B: happiness C: amusement D: losing money E: anger<n><n>### Response:		<n>Let's help them figure out how to spend their time and have fun.<n><n>### Example:<n>Input:What do you need to spend on a bike for $450?<n><n>### Instructor response:<n>The answer is $50.<n><n>### Output:<n>You can buy the bike for $100 less than you thought if your budget was correct.<n>

Letter E would be to the right of the even number.<n>In the example A is an even number that could be 3, The number is an even number between 2, 3, and 4, the answer is D.<n><n>### Example of an instruction that completes the request. Example of a response that appropriately addresses the request.<n><n>An example of a poorly written instruction.<n>Examples of appropriate response and poor response.<n>A.If A is an even NUmber between B, C, D, it belongs to D<n>B.A is between B,C, and D<n><n>If A is an Even Number between B,C,and D, It belongs to D<n><n>### If a word problem is asked<n>Asked to write 3 sentences that appropriately complete the

Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is bee hive.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>- The answer choices are bee hive, England, castle, the deck of cards, and chess game.<n>- The bee hive does not always have a queen due to factors like: <n>	- The queen might leave her hive to mate with the king. <n>	- The bees might kill her due to parasitic cells found in her food. <n>	- She might be eaten by the worker bees.<n>- There is a possibility (not certainty) that the other choices may not always have a queen, but the question specifically points out England.  Hence the answer is Bee hive.<n>

If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:How can you get in shape if there is no land nearby? Choices:  A: swim B: jog C: excercise D: work out E: rock climb<n><n>### Response:		<n>Exercise A helps to get in shape. You can start by doing some warm up exercises such as walking up stairs, doing jumping jacks, or marching in place. After doing a warm up you are ready to get serious with a proper exercise routine. Walking, jogging, running, skipping, jumping, twisting, turning, lifting, running, push-ups, sit-ups etc. are all effective exercises for burning off those unwanted calories. So the answer is A.<n><n>#### Reason:<n>A: exercise<n><n>B: jog<n><n>C: excercise<n><n>D: work out<n><n>E: rock climb<n>

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:In the movie a fragile man is causing accidents, his hope is to find a person opposite of him who is what? He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Choices:  A: hatred B: surprised C: compliments D: dedication E: solutions<n><n>### Response:		<n>It is a well known fact that luck sometimes determines success. However, as the old saying goes, "Where there is a will there is a way." That means, if you put your mind to something and work towards it, you can achieve it. Focus is definitely the key. You have to have focus when you are doing something. When you are focused on something there is a high chance of you actually achieving it. The second component of success is dedication. You cannot succeed in anything if you are not dedicated enough. So you have to dedicate your time, energy and efforts towards what you want to succeed in. When dedication, focus and a lot of hard work goes in, you can only get success. When you dedicate your time in practice, you gradually improve yourself, thus you get better and better with time with the right attitude. You only get rewarded with success if you are very focused about it. Choices:  A: raise corn B: seed plants C: grow plants D: seed crops E: farm land<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice: D.<n><n>### Input-Demonstration:<n>The farmer chose plants that he could raise corn and use of again the following year, he only plant seed and crop.<n><n>### Question Title:<n><n>Choose the best option that corrects the sentence.<n><n>### If the farmer raises corn he can use his field for seed again.<n>A B<n>### Answer:<n>D<n><n>#### ### Correct answer <n><n>### Question title:<n><n>Rewrite the sentence using the given words to express essentially the same idea as the sentence.<n><n>####  If the farmer had raised corn the field could have been grown again.<n><n>#### ### Correted response:<n>####  Use the given words to express roughly the same idea as the original sentence.<n><n>#### ##<n><n>### Read the sentence and identify the error, choosing the best option that correct it.<n><n>#### ## <n><n>### Reach the conclusion.<n>1. ___  The farmer chose plants he planted and could use the same field again the next year.<n>2. ___  The plants only raised corn and would not help the chicken feed.<n><n>####  How about the conclusion:<n><n>#### ##<n>

Choices:  A: istanbul B: animal C: antique shop D: human being E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions: <n>Instructions: Provide detailed explanations of your answer.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: Mark and Harry are arguing about whether a particular person is male or female, their statements being "No, he/she isn't" and "Yes, he/she is!" What is the truth?<n><n>### Response<n>Response: 3 (True)<n><n>Explained: The rule of biconditional is used in determining whether a person is male or not male. The person is actually a "he", so the statement "No, he/he isn't" is true ("he" is not male), but the statement "Yes, he/he is" is false ("he" is male). (3)<n><n>### Input <n>Input: Mark and his father decided to go to the movies together.  Mark and his father can take 10 seats in a theater with a total of 12 seats.  How many seats can still be used?<n><n>### Responses<n>Responses:<n>4 (None)<n>8 (Two)<n>9 (One)<n>3 (Three)<n><n>### Instuctions<n>Instructions: You are allowed to answer with all correct answers to the task.<n><n>### Explained<n>Explained:  4) They can't take all the seats because there's nobody in between them.  <n>8) The seats can't be filled because the father has to sit in one seat and his son has to sit in the other seat.  As Mark and his father can each take 10 seats, this answers that there is 1 seat leftover.  <n>9)  The seats on the left can't be filled, so the seats on the right can't be filled.  <n>3) Mark's father says "Three".  <n><n>### Instrictions<n>Instructions to provide detailed explanations of your answers.<n><n>### Submit your answers<n>Submit your answers to the task for review and feedback.<n>

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Choices:  A: spinning wheel B: on a ladder C: hospital bed D: legroom E: grand piano<n><n>### Response:		The closest answer to the response is B. The response that goes closest to the answer is the one for B, a person can lie on a hospital bed with his legs elevated. Choice A. Spinning Wheel is the answer that is most distant from the question, it gives the opposite information, because most people do not use a spinning wheel to rest the legs. The most distant option, choice D, gives incorrect information, a person cannot lie with a legroom, legs do not stand on the floor. This choice is not the answer according to the instructions of the query. Choice C, is the closest of the wrong answers, the only thing that a person cannot do in a hospital bed is to walk, which is to lie, and this is the incorrect statement to rest a broken leg. So, the closest answer is B, Hospital bed.<n><n>### Input:"Where does someone lay with his leg elevated when it is broken?"<n><n>### Demo response:<n><n>### Response analysis:<n><n>* The closest response is the one of the choices: B<n>* The response which gives the most similar information to the answer is B, the person who rests their leg on a hospital bed.<n>* The response that gives the opposite information to the answer is A, spinning wheel, which does not allow to put a leg in that object.<n>* The response which is most far from the answer is D, legroom, which is not possible to put a legroom and keep the legs elevated. The second distant is C, hospital bed, which also does not allow to rest it in a position with the legs elevated.<n><n>The answer B, hospital bed.<n><n>## Exercise 7:<n><n>Write a response that appropriately answers the questions.<n><n>### Question:How many people can ride on a horse if they do it back to back? <n><n>### Exercise 6:<n><n>Below is an instruction that describes the requirements for a task. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:He had an index card he had to return, so where did he put it after finding the book he needed? Choices:  A: inside the book B: oral report C: library D: fileing cabnet E: card catalogue<n><n>### Response:		<n>He was going to put it in the oral report cabinet.<n><n>### Input:(The number of days in school was $x) (The number of days they were on vacation was $y) Choices: A: They went on a trip to AustraliaB: They had 3 weeks offC: They spent the summer in New YorkD: They took 5 day trips to DisneylandE: They spent the summer swimming in the pool<n><n>### Response:(The number of days they spent was $x + y)<n><n>### Input :(The number of letters he sent came to 28. He sent 5 more letters than she did.) (The girl sent 8 more letters than the boy.) Choices: A: None of the aboveB: She sent 7 letters more than the boyC: None of the aboveD: None of the aboveE: She sent 21 more letters than the boy.F: She sent twice as many letters as the boy.)<n><n>### Response :(The girl sent $(21 - (5 - 8))$ letters)<n><n>---

Choices:  A: shelf B: desktop C: cabinet D: kitchen E: cupboard<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:In the question above write your code of the instruction.  There is a program that was written to be run at 3 AM every Sunday of the month which cleans the shelves and moves them to the cupboard. If something else has been put in the shelves other than food it will be moved to the correct place.<n><n>Output: The code has no error, now go to'shelf.py'<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input in the program'shelf.py':<n><n>```python<n>shelf.py<n><n>if item == "Sausage":<n>    print("Please move this to kitchen")<n>    item.toss(random.randint(0, 10), shelf)<n>    item.recycle(random.randint(-50, 50), kitchen)<n>else:<n>    print("Please put this on shelf")<n>   item.put(random.randint(), shelf)<n><n>    <n>def put(x, y):<n>    x.put(y)<n><n>def toss(x, y): <n>    print(x * "tossed from")<n>    print(x)<n>    x.put()<n>    tossed = 10<n>    x.put = x.put - x.put<n>    if x.put < 0:<n>        x.putback(0)<n>    else:<n>        print("The toss is " + str(x.put))<n>        <n>def recycle(x, y):  <n>    print(x* "recycle from")<n>    print (x)<n>    recycled = 50<n>    x.recycle = x.recycle - x.recycle<n>    if x.recycle < 0:<n>       x.recycleback(0)<n>       print("The kitchen is empty!")<n>    else:<n>            print("The recycle is " + str(1))<n>            if recycled > 0:<n>                x.distrbute()<n>                recycle = 0<n>            else:<n>            return<n>```<n><n>Input:Please put this on shelves<n><n>OUTPUT: "Please throw this to kitchen" "Please put this on shelve"<n><n>### Instuctions:Your challenge is to complete the

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. Where would he go to get to the third floor of his apartment building? Choices:  A: space shuttle B: detroit C: stairs D: downtown E: elevator<n><n>### Response:		Elevator<n>### Input:Mary has 3 times as many toys. She has 8 pairs of shoes and there are 4 extra for her friend. How many toys, shoes and extra pairs does Mary have?<n>Analyze the given instruction and determine how you will accomplish the task requested.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>In the instruction, Mary is given 3 times as many than toys.  She also has 8 pairs of shoe, and there 4 extra pairs. This is a situation where 18 is needed to be added to the number of toys or shoes.<n><n>### Input - First part: John has an 8-cylinder gasoline-powered engine.  That engine needs 14 times as much gas as the 4-cylinder engine has.  The 4 cylinder engine lasts 28 times longer than the 8-cylider engine.<n><n>### Comment 1<n>How much longer does the 4 cylinder engine need to last for the 8 cylinder engine to last for 7 years.<n><n>### Answer 1:<n>The 4 cylinder engine needs to last 28 years for the 8 cylender engine to last for 28 times longer.<n>If the 8 enginer lasted 28 times longer, it would be 8 times longer, which means 8√ó7 years = 56 years.<n>So the 4 cylinder would need to last for 56 years to balance the 8 cylinder, which would mean the 4 cylinder enginer needs to last for 5 times as long as the 8 cylinder enginer.<n><n>\$\iff 14x(8) = 8x(4)\$<n>Since 14x( 8) is bigger, you would need 1 more round of division than you would need multiplication to get your goal of (8x(4)). So this is where you need the 14 times as many than statement.<n><n>$\$\iff14\*8=8\*4$$<n><n>This is equivalent to $\$\iff 112=32$$<n><n>So to make an 8 cylinder engine last 7 years, the 4 cylinder must last 7 times as long as the regular enginer (so 6 years).

Choices:  A: lot of grief B: depression C: no spouse D: lose money E: children suffer<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### If it's A, the answer would be E, if it's B, the answer would be C, if it's D the answer would be A, and if it's A, then the answer would be D.<n><n>### Input:(113)-(24) = _____<n><n>### Response :<n>#### If 113-24 = 89, then it would be an A because of the number in the parentheses and the operation which is- (113)-(89)=24<n><n>### Instuction: What is the lowest, whole-numbered price of a car that costs $8460 and is on sale for 15%-5%-9%?<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### To find the lowest whole number, divide 8460 by 0.15 = 560, then multiply by 0.05 then 0.09. 560.05 = 140 then 560.9 = 560.<n><n>### In order to solve a question like this, the first number should be in parenthesis and the second number and operator should be after the first number.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:James is very interested in other planets. How many more cups were left after these three groups?<n><n>### Response<n>412 more cups.<n><n>### Your teacher has a homework assignment for next week.  They ask you to write a paragraph about the effects of the Coronavirus.  If you know what a paragraph is, you'll complete this task.<n><n>### Response <n>Coronavirus is a virus that causes flu-like symptoms. It is most severe in older adults or those with serious health problems. It can lead to pneumonia in the most severe cases. The risk depends on existing medical condition and age. Those with serious underlying medical conditions like heart disease are most at risk. Children under age 2 are at very low risk. The disease can spread from an infected person through respiratory droplets released when talking, sneezing, or coughing. To avoid spreading the disease, avoid close contact with people who are coughing or sneezing.<n><n><n>

The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? If there are two sections of every class, each section

How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. Everyone on the third spot must leave and sit down. If the game is to continue after this step, how many people will be on the third spot by the end of the game?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Everyone on the third seat must leave the circle and sit down. How many people will be in the third spot by the time the game is over?<n>Answer: 7.5 ( 7 + 0.5)<n><n>### Expected Solution:<n>Input: A game where three volunteers have to sit in a circle and be choosing their friends to sit in three of the spots. Everyone in a third spot must leave and be sitting down. If the game would continue after this step, by the end of the steps the third spot spot must be 7 and 50% ( 3/6 = 1/2(1/2)) of the circle would be empty.<n><n>### Input/Expected Solutions:<n>Input:  A game where three volunteer will be sitting in a circle will have to chose three of their friends to sit next to them. Everyone on the third position must leave the circle and be sitting down. By the end of the game, only two people will be sitting in the third spot.<n><n>Input:  A round of drinks at a bar costs $10 for men and $20 for women. There are ten women and five men at the bar.  Who pays the most?<n>Answer:  Five men. (80-5x10)<n>In the second round a man can buy a drink for $10.  He decides to buy two drinks, how many other men join in?<n>Answer: Seven men.<n><n>### <n><n>#### #1<n><n>#### #2<n><n>#### #3<n><n>### The next problem will work with a few variables: x, y, z, etc. <n><n>#### #4<n><n>### 4.<n>The next task will require you to solve the code given below. <n><n>#### 1.<n>```<n>if (A>B)<n>    A+=B<n>    B=B<n>```<n>####

If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:What is KFC who serves chicken? Choices:  A: fast food restaurant B: plate C: bowl D: freezer E: oven<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> ## Answer:<n>><n>> ### 3<n><n>> ### Challenge:<n>><n>> <n>><n>> ### Solution:<n>><n>> ```python<n>> import math<n>> <n>> def main(x):<n>>     if input(x) == 'A': x*6 and print (x*6)+"\n"<n>>     if input('(B)') == 'B': if (x*6)*4 > 48 then print ('Not enough!') but else if (x*6)<48 then x += 1 and print x*6+"\n"<n>> <n>> main(input_question_number())<n>> ```<n>> <n>> ### Challenge:  <n>> <n>> <n>>      Write a comment explaining the code above in an explanation that would help a colleague understand your code.<n>> <n>>     You can skip this part if you'd rather not.<n>> <n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write a program or function that when passed a number that represents the number of items in an inventory, can return the item that has that many items and if the item is a bowl, print the amount of food in grams that can be held in the bowl. If no item has as many or more items than the number that is passed, the program should print that "no bowl with that many items will be found."<n><n>For example:<n><n>### Demand:<n><n>Number of items: 5<n><n>### Output in the following format:<n><n>Item: the number of items<n>Name: the name of the item<n>Food in Grams: the amount of grams the bowl can hold<n>Item Type: the type of item ("Bowl")<n><n>### Sample Input:<n><n>5<n><n>### Sample Output:<n><n>Item: 5<n>Name: Bowl #5<n>Food in Grates: 150<n>Item Type: Bowl<n><n>### Hint:<n><n>Use Dictionary to store the name of each item with its corresponding number of items it can hold.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>```python<n><n>import math<n><n>def main(x):<n>    if input(x)=='5':<n>        f=dict()<n>        n=0<n>        i=0<n>        j=0<n>

Then, multiply by 4, the result is 196. Lastly, add 18 and the answer will be 214<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Answer: 35<n><n>### Step 1:<n>Divide each of the numbers by 2.<n>```<n>500 // 250<n>50 // 25<n>103 // 51.5<n>426 // 213<n>```<n><n>### Step2:<n>To 103 round it off to 104. Then subtract 15 because rounding it off.<n>```<n>100// 21.25 and 60// 212.5<n><n>100 // 4.89<n><n>60// 4.625<n>```<n><n>## Step 3 : <n>Now add 10 to the final list.<n>```<n>140// 290<n>154// 314.01<n>```<n><n>## Aggregate : <n>The final answer is 154 and the amount of the answer is $314.001.<n><n>

B: He knew that all bats were black and had huge ears. C: There was a pile of bat poop on the top of the house. D: The bats were all flying outside in the night.<n><n>### Response<n><n>B<n> <n>### Instruction<n><n>Demonstrate your skills as a programmer by writing code that will complete this request. Your submission will be evaluated according to how well you write idiomatic code for MATLAB. Write code that is readable, understandable, and runs efficiently.<n><n>### Request:<n><n>The input variable (x) represents the length in hours of a shift at 00:00. The output represents the number of hours of sleep required, based on the shift length and a set of inputs given in the assignment. <n><n>### Input<n><n>0.33 hours<n><n>### Output<n><n>3.1525<n><n>### Solution<n><n>x=input('x')<n>SLEEP=0.3384    % sleep hours per shift<n>SLEEP/24    % hours per day<n>% convert hours to days<n>if x>=1<n>    x=x-1<n>    temp=x*SLEEP/2<n>    if x-temp>=0<n>        x=x-temp<n>        sleep=Sleep+temp/24*2<n>    end<n>end<n>sleep=sleep+0.338*24<n><n>### Output:<n><n>3.1955555619<n><n>### Solution: Part 2:<n><n>Sleep=0.339;<n>x*Sleep/24<n>x=x-1<n>% temp*Sleep/23; temp=0.335<n>temp1=(x-temp)*Sleep/24;temp*Sleep/2<n>result1 = round(temp1*12 + temp1/24);<n>result2 = round(x*Sleep);<n>x=x-result2;<n>x=x-time(result1)*60;<n>sleep=result1+result2<n><n>### Output 2:<n><n>3<n><n>### Solution 2: Part 3:<n>

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:What would humans do when their legs are tired? Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose a correct answer(a - e) to the question.<n><n>## Sample Questions<n><n>1. I want to solve the right hand side for x.<n>I have the problem f(x) = 24x2 + 5x -1 and I want to plug in numbers to see the equation in action.<n>I have the program and I want to add one more column to the grid, the column for the sum of the total.<n>I have to write a program that generates 10 random prime numbers.<n><n>---<n><n><n>### Input :Write a program that calculates the area of a square if you are given sides of length, a.<n><n>### Response : <n><n>### Input<n>A: -5<n><n>### Demo<n>You would want to write the program in excel using VBA or macro because it is easier than coding and typing each individual number.<n><n>In VBA you would use:<n><n><n><n>### Instructon :Write a program to determine which of the three students, 48, 26, and 24 has the fewest number of students in the grade after the other two.<n><n><n>### Demoscation<n><n>Write a function that takes 3 numbers, 0,2,3. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:What has highly criticized security? Choices:  A: university B: concert C: home D: terminal E: airport<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: 1,000+ kids are at a birthday party. The party started at 11 A.M., but the kids didn't start cleaning up and leaving until 3:45 P.M.<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>The total time spent in the event is: <n><n>13.5<n><n>### Input 2:<n>One number is 90. Another number is 2 times the previous number. What's the sum of the two numbers?<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>450

Choices:  A: concert B: opera C: theater D: take class E: television<n><n>### Response:		<n>A.<n><n>### Response 2:<n>B.<n><n>### Responses 3:<n>C.<n><n>### Final Response:<n>D.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Jeremy is trying to write 1/4 of a number in his journal.  The process of learning to write fractions is much like learning how to write the number line. If he has a number line of length 12 inches, he can put a mark on the line that is 4 inches away from 0.  This place is marked by the fraction 4/12.  Next, he will use it as a reference when he writes down the number line, so this fraction will no longer be used.  He will move 2/12 mark forward on the number line for 2/12ths of the distance between 0 and 4/12ths.  He can write 2/12 on the line.  He can put the 2 as the numerator for 2/1)2 and then, because he's going to write the line in the opposite direction, he can write the denominator at the top to show where he is.  This fraction is read "2/12."  Repeating the process for the next 2/12 will allow him to write a fraction that represents 1/4.<n><n>### Output<n><n>In that case he could move 2/11 to the 2/12 fraction, using 2/12 as a reference point for how far he'll go.  He now writes 2/11 and puts the 2 as the top of the fraction.  He can then put the 11 on the floor in the same way that you might put an exponent on the floor when writing the fraction 2(11).<n><n>### Input and output 3<n><n>He also wants to write a fraction that is 1/6th of some other number.  He can use the 1-12 line as a way to go from 1/4 to 1/6 in a series of steps.  Using what he knows about writing fractions to the 12th, he can find the fraction 1/6 as follows:<n><n>First, he will write the fractions and the first 1/4, just as he demonstrated above.  The

An example would include the following instructions:  Input: x = 2  x + y + z = 10  z = input: y  y = sum of input  x = 2(x + y)  Output: x + y = 9<n><n>### Instructioin:The task involves two questions. For the whole task, if answers to both are provided the overall score will be as follows:<n><n>### Instuction:Another task asks the user to input values for a+b, which is a variable that is passed back to exercise 2.<n><n>### Exercise 1 will require the user to enter the value of a+(b^2+c) to get the final answer.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:When playing baseball they keep track of mistakes, this stat is called what? Choices:  A: happiness B: sore muscles C: injury D: perfection E: errors<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The letter stands for the term eror, as it's on the number 2 and 4 on a clock.<n><n>### Input<n>When playing basketball, they keep track of how many mistakes the team makes when shooting, this stat is called? Choices: A: happiness B: Sore muscles C: Injury D: perfection E Errors<n>### Response<n>The letter on the clock stands for what, making the term error.<n><n>### Examples:<n>What does the word ‚Äúhour‚Äù mean on the clock?<n>### Response: 2 letters<n><n>### Input and Response

Choices:  A: own house B: better job C: win lottery D: save money E: feel safe<n><n>### Response:		A: own house<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following open ended paragraph.<n><n>### Paragraph:Dear Sir's,<n><n>I would like to share an interesting story with you about the power and impact of words. When I joined this company as a new employee, I was given an opportunity to present myself and my expertise to the leadership team. I was asked to introduce myself and share what I would like to accomplish at my new role.<n><n>I was extremely nervous and excited, but after some nervous laughter my co-worker and I sat down to try to gather our thoughts. We began discussing what our strengths were and how we could build on them to support our new goals at this company. As I sat there and spoke about the work that I did at my old job, I realized that I wanted to learn so much more. I didn't realize how the words that I used at that time contributed to where I am now. In a very short period of time, I was able to achieve so much more at my job. I have accomplished many things, but the one thing that stands out to me is when I asked my manager to write a letter of recommendation for me and when I got it back it was absolutely beautiful and very detailed. When I looked at the letter as I was reading it, I was able to tell that it captured the words that I used in my initial conversations with him.<n><n>During our weekly meetings he often asked me what was going on with my job search. I was happy to tell Him everything that I was up to because I think that he knew how important this role was at such a great organization. He always had an encouraging comment about how happy he was that I was doing well and how the company needed people like me to grow and develop. Words can make such a powerful difference and I am so thankful that I found this role and I am so thank ful to all of you. You have made it an amazing place to work.<n><n>### Notes:Notes:  In a very short period, I was able to accomplish a lot.<n><n>### Response to Notes:Notes:In a very short period of 4 months, I was able to acquire a lot of knowledge and get some experience.<n>

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		(B)<n><n>### Input<n>1. Which of the following is NOT a possible solution set?<n>A. {16}<n>B. {1, 2, 4, 8, 16}<n>C. {1}<n>D. {1,2,4}<n>2. Write a statement that will return the number of even numbers in the set of numbers in array A.<n>A. answer = len(arrayA) % 2<n>B. answer = len(set(arrayA))<n>C. answer = len(enumerate(arrayA))<n>D. answer = any(arrayA)<n>3.
